image.altText: Police officers searching a dam

props.synopsis: Victoria Police have recovered a phone as they search a dam south of Ballarat as part of their investigation into the alleged murder of mother-of-three Samantha Murphy.

title.children: Divers search dam as police find 'items of interest' in Samantha Murphy search

image.altText: A police officer walks beside a taller individual in a grey tracksuit along a street next to a police van.

props.synopsis: It is alleged the 18-year-old was one of a group of men who was involved in a violent home invasion at a Conder home earlier this month.

title.children: Teenager faces court, manhunt underway over alleged stabbing of two people in Canberra

image.altText: A framed picture of a man wearing a button up shirt and tie with facial hair

props.synopsis: Nathan Booth's body was found on the bank of the Murrumbidgee River in 2019, and his family are still looking for answers.

title.children: 'Should not have been allowed to happen': Coroner apologises to family of man whose body was found on riverbank

image.altText: The sign out of the front of the courts building and the crest, with an autumnal tree nearby and a blue sky beyond.

props.synopsis: Chris Payne, 37, allegedly shot at a car with an infant inside. Today the magistrate described it as a "significant issue of public safety" and moved to have him tried in the ACT Supreme Court.

title.children: Canberra man who allegedly shot at car with baby inside committed to face ACT Supreme Court

image.altText: Andrew Giles in his office.

props.synopsis: Andrew Giles is refusing to step aside as immigration minister, despite agreeing to tear up a contentious direction to his department and Commonwealth tribunals that has led to convicted criminals being allowed to remain in the country.

title.children: Giles won't step aside as pressure mounts over detainee release saga

image.altText: police cars parked along a shaded road in pialligo

props.synopsis: Police say a man is assisting them with enquiries after the body of a woman was found at a house in Pialligo on Tuesday morning.

title.children: Man questioned, released without charge after body of woman found at bottom of stairs at Canberra home

image.altText: land clearing 1

props.synopsis: Unauthorised bulldozing of "really important" native vegetation has landed NSW Southern Highlands property owner Chaza Khouzame a $125,000 fine, plus costs.

title.children: Landowner fined $125,000 after ignoring orders to stop clearing native bush, 200-year-old trees

image.altText: A skull from the side, with E270 on one side, and a crater like hole at the top

props.synopsis: Researchers have uncovered what look like surgery marks on an ancient Egyptian skull with remains of a tumour-like growth, suggesting ancient Egyptians not only got cancer, they may also have tried to treat it.

title.children: An ancient treatment for cancer? 4,000-year-old Egyptian skull a 'milestone in the history of medicine'

image.altText: Hannah sings into a microphone in a frilly pink dress with white underwear on display. A shirtless man plays a pink piano.

props.synopsis: It's Pay Day! Australian drag superstar Hannah Conda explains the expensive reality behind the scenes of her glitzy appearances on RuPaul's Drag Race, and the travel mistake that led her to the lowest point in her financial life.

title.children: The $4,000 travelling mistake that left drag superstar Hannah Conda at the 'lowest point in her financial life'

image.altText: A woman wearing a black suede shirt sits in a large green chair and smiles.

props.synopsis: After losing her son to suicide six years ago, Kate Slatter thought she knew how to handle complex grief. But it was after the sudden death of another close family member that she found herself overwhelmed and in need of an end-of-life expert carer.

title.children: How end-of-life doulas are changing the way people think about death

image.altText: Photograph of a new apartment block with a shaded map of LGAs overlaid.

props.synopsis: NSW Premier Chris Minns says the new housing targets for 43 local government areas were designed to help the state meet its commitment under the National Housing Accord to build 377,000 new well-located homes by 2029.

title.children: The Sydney suburbs that will bear the brunt of premier's revised housing targets

image.altText: The back of a police officer looking towards damaged and overturned carriages

props.synopsis: Rail authorities were alerted to the fatal consequences of a train and truck crash in SA's north when a member of the public answered one of the dead drivers' phones, a preliminary report by the Australian Transport Safety Bureau finds.

title.children: Member of the public picked up dead train driver's phone after horrific truck crash, ATSB reveals

image.altText: Andrew Giles looks down while sitting in question time in the house of representatives

props.synopsis: The future of embattled Immigration Minister Andrew Giles hangs with Anthony Albanese. But sacking the factional heavyweight could bring with it problems for the prime minister so close to an election.

title.children: Breakfast TV can make political careers. Andrew Giles might soon learn it can break them too

image.altText: Mikaela Colquhoun and Cooper Morgenstern with their cat Sir Puddin Stacks

props.synopsis: The owners of a pet cat shot with an air rifle urge others to speak up about animal cruelty so perpetrators can be brought to justice.

title.children: Adored pet cat Sir Puddin Stacks reunites with family after being shot by air rifle

image.altText: A jogger runs past a mural with orange, red and purple colours and a wattle flower on a seawall

props.synopsis: The public response to a piece of street art in beachside Adelaide is under fire from the local mayor, who says both the artist and a resident opposed to the mural have been subjected to "online vitriol".

title.children: 'Nasty' and 'disturbing' response to mural along Adelaide beach condemned by mayor

image.altText: A close-up shot of an older woman with blonde hair looking to her right, with another blonde woman on her left.

props.synopsis: The sister of Lynn Cannon, who was killed by her estranged husband in Perth, says her family's tragedy has been repeated by the Floreat murders.

title.children: As people come to terms with yet another DV murder, the families of women killed by men shake their heads

image.altText: Police officer looks away from camera at a press conference

props.synopsis: Police Commissioner Michael Murphy has admitted at a coronial inquest that he did nothing when he first heard allegations of racism within an elite policing unit.

title.children: NT police commissioner admits he knew about racist awards months ago but did nothing

image.altText: A man wipes tears away with his jacket, flanked by two other men looking downcast.

props.synopsis: Vast uncertainty surrounds the final death toll from last week's catastrophic landslide in Papua New Guinea's Enga Province with a local official saying he believes 162 people have been killed in the natural disaster — far fewer than estimated by the United Nations or the country's government.

title.children: Local PNG official casts doubt on PNG landslide death toll, saying 162 people have died

image.altText: Eight items of clothing are hung on black clothes hangers, including three singlets, three pairs of pants, and a white shirt.

props.synopsis: Whether you shop in-store or online, retailers are ramping up sales to entice us to part with our cash. But, as spending flatlines, discounting doesn't appear to have the same effect it used to, sparking warnings of looming retail collapses.

title.children: If you've noticed almost every retail store is having a sale right now, it's because they are. Here's why

image.altText: a man holding his hands together

props.synopsis: The complaint stems from an interview the influential tycoon gave to foreign media in 2015, and was lodged by the royalist military that ousted the government of his sister, Yingluck Shinawatra.

title.children: Thai former PM Thaksin Shinawatra set to face trial over alleged royal insult

image.altText: A tight head and shoulders shot of WA Police Commissioner Col Blanch speaking while wearing his police uniform.

props.synopsis: Authorities in WA have leapt to defend the way police responded to concerns raised by the wife and daughter of Floreat double murderer Mark Bombara prior to the shootings.

title.children: WA police commissioner says it's 'wrong' to say nothing was done prior to Floreat murders

image.altText: A close-up shot of a shopping trolley full of groceries in a supermarket with a woman behind bagging apples.

props.synopsis: The annual rate of inflation has ticked up slightly in April to 3.6 per cent, from 3.5 per cent in March, but economists say it's enough to put even more pressure on the Reserve Bank.

title.children: Inflation rises slightly in April to 3.6pc but economists say that should ring 'alarm bells' for RBA

image.altText: A child rests in her mother's arms while surrounded by debris and garbage.

props.synopsis: Palestinian civilians in Gaza hoped that last week's ruling from the International Court of Justice might represent a turning point, but it has quickly turned into an argument about legal interpretation and world order.

title.children: A court ruling on Israel's invasion of Rafah has turned into a complicated legal argument. Here's why

image.altText: A blackened field following a fire caused by a deadly light plane crash, with police walking and positioning traffic cones.

props.synopsis: A report finds it is likely the pilot of a Cessna plane "lost awareness" of a powerline stretching across his property before clipping it and crashing, killing him and his son.

title.children: Calls for powerline marking programs after light plane crash investigation

image.altText: Long-distance shot of a tornado-like cloud taken in Western Australia.

props.synopsis: Dunsborough residents get a spectacular view as the year's first winter storms rolled in across South Western WA.

title.children: Bureau says stronger rain coming after storms buffet southern Western Australia

image.altText: An older man with grey hair poses in front of a black, yellow and white backdrop

props.synopsis: A Massachusetts theatre has issued an apology after Jaws actor Richard Dreyfuss used the event to air demeaning remarks about women and the LGBTQIA+ community.

title.children: US theatre apologises for Jaws actor Richard Dreyfuss’s 'offensive remarks' during event

image.altText: A composite image of George Bailey and David Warner

props.synopsis: What do you do when the national side is two players short in a key World Cup warm-up? Send on the chief selector and fielding coach, of course.

title.children: Australian selector and fielding coach forced to take to the field in bizarre World Cup warm-up

image.altText: F/A-18 Hornet

props.synopsis: They are likely the most-recognisable fighter in the Royal Australian Air Force, but the days of spotting a F/A-18 "Classic Hornet" could be over.

title.children: Queensland museum scrambling to secure F/A-18 Classic Hornet before they're lost to history

image.altText: PALM scheme workers picking celery and placing it on a conveying belt for processing.

props.synopsis: Growers will now be able to offer PALM workers 120 hours of labour averaged over four weeks rather than having to guarantee them 30 hours of employment per week.

title.children: 'Common sense' changes to Pacific workers scheme see minimum weekly hours scrapped

image.altText: Looking down from the top of Gunlom Falls in the Northern Territory.

props.synopsis: Parks Australia says it will plead guilty to allegations it damaged a sacred site in Kakadu during construction work in 2019 – an incident that set off long-running court action and a bitter dispute between traditional owners and the Commonwealth body.

title.children: Parks Australia to plead guilty over alleged sacred site damage at Kakadu's Gunlom Falls

image.altText: A large white balloon carrying a bad of trash hovers over a rice field.

props.synopsis: Unidentified objects believed to be from North Korea were seen near the heavily fortified border.

title.children: Balloons carrying trash and excrement reportedly dropped on South Korea from the north

image.altText: An egg carton with eggs of varying hues in it.

props.synopsis: Japan has joined the United States in banning poultry imports from Victoria, as the state works to control two outbreaks of avian influenza.

title.children: Japan, US among countries to ban Victorian poultry imports due to bird flu

image.altText: A smiling man in a cap stands in a paddock with rice growing in it.

props.synopsis: Australian rice growers have mixed views about the biggest shake-up of the industry in 100 years, but change is on the way.

title.children: SunRice monopoly set to end, Australian growers eye new markets

image.altText: A tour guide with a guest

props.synopsis: Increasing numbers of visitors to Far North Queensland are learning about traditional culture on country. The Indigenous guides showing them around say it goes to the meaning of reconciliation.

title.children: Tour company teaching traditional culture on country honoured at Qld Reconciliation Awards

image.altText: A Sydney Opera House snow globe with 'no war' written on the sails.

props.synopsis: Twenty-one years since the historic Opera House "NO WAR" protest, the men behind the handiwork have revealed how they pulled it off — and how they view it now a new war is waged in the Middle East.

title.children: The ingenious way the Opera House protesters paid off their $151K fine
